It's a shame nobody knows about this classic, probably the greatest game of all time.

[b]Yeah, im about to talk about a game released 16 years ago.

I mean, the store ID is 60, its one of the lowest since steam has started working, so yeah it's a very vintage game and I'm going to review it.[/b]

[u]This game has no plot whatsoever just welcome to the Tron arena of the 2000's.[/u]

Quick action FPS focused in quick reaction time, you throw discs and you kill other players, just like the description says, it's a battle arena:

[quote=Valve at the Ricochet's description] "A futuristic action game that challenges your agility as well as your aim, Ricochet features one-on-one and team matches played in a variety of futuristic battle arenas." [/quote]

The game is very fun and it runs on the Half-Life engine, the gameplay is very fun and the controls are very good. It's probably the one lightest game that valve has developed and it will be  downloaded and installed in less than 3 minutes.
You can grab it for 3.74$ or with a massive discount during sales, during sales it has been seen to go for 0.99$ or 0.74$, it's included in the counter strike anthology pack.

I mean you can play this game on a toaster:

[quote=Valve, about system requirements]
MINIMUM: 500 MHz processor, 96mb ram, 16mb video card, Windows XP, Mouse, Keyboard, Internet Connection

RECOMMENDED: 800 MHz processor, 128mb ram, 32mb+ video card, Windows XP, Mouse, Keyboard, Internet Connection
[/quote]

[b]Pros:[/b]

• You can install it in a matter of seconds

• Its easy to understand the gameplay

• Gameplay is small but very entertaining

• Very good to train accuaracy

• Bouncing arround and shooting disks is very fun

• You can decapitate your enemies or watche them fall to the void.

[b]Cons:[/b]

• Community is very small

• Game has a lack of servers and players

• There are only 6 maps wich most of them look the same but with different layouts

• Most servers are laggy / abandoned

• It's a very repetitive game.

[b][u] Dont take me wrong, I might be going hard on a game that was made in 2000, but as a game reviewer I have to see both good and bad sides, this game isnt bad at all for me and i dont think any of those cons will affect your reactin to the game, its a good game just to grab and play.[/u][/b]

It's the most entertaining game that you can grab and play 10 minutes every day or while you are bored.

I give this game a big [spoiler][b]8/10[/b][/spoiler]

[b][u]This game is completely good, like I said before the gameplay is very entertaining and fun and the controls are very easy to get used to, of course, its still a game that has around 3-6 maps only, still, its a very fun game that you can grab during a sale and enjoy it a lot.

There are around 3 servers that have people, and that's just daily, you can still approach this game during a sale and play it, its fun and very addictive if you get good at it.

No se porque pero tengo bugueadas las horas de juego, en realidad tengo 1,303 hs pero no se porque figuran menos T.T. 10/10 Puta mierda

Oh boy, Ricochet.

Ricochet is probably the worst Valve game ever. This game feels like Tron. You know Tron? Where the people ride disks and throw motorcycles? Its just like that, just without motorcycles and any servers with more than 5 people on it because this game is @$$. You bounce around on these little neon platforms and shoot disks at people. Its bad. This game seems like it would call a flash game site its home, afterall the game only takes up 16mb of space on your computer. Whats really sad is that this game costs $5 on Steam. Luckily I got it in bundle. There are few servers running that actually have people playing. When you get onto one of those you relize that there are no dedicated servers for this game. Everyone on the server is running 100+ ping. Everyone is named Player for some reason and no one demonstrates any kind of skill in game. I ended up at the top of the leader boards within 2 minutes of joining a server, with 300 ping. Without anykind of tutorial or campaign your left to figure things out by yourself. I still don't understand what I'm doing but I guess I'm doing the right things because I'm destroying everyone on the server.

When you get tired of playing laggy multiplayer, you want to play with some skilled bots. Nope. No bots. Fuck this game man.
Steam и Valve вы... это... про эту... как его?.. игру... не за... забыли?... Во!

ira men deja te explico yo no vengo ofendiendo a nadien carnal y estoy tratando de exponer un punto de vista y llegas con insultos y pues asi no se puede men si te pido respeto xqe tambien ay damas que estan viendo tus insultos sale? gracias d antemano.﻿

It's a total waste of 5 bucks on a game that literally no one plays anymore. All the servers are empty, the game mechanics and graphics are old and outdated, and it's just plain boring giving that the game has no "bots" option. I know it's a really old game, but seriously, I don't know why anyone would want to play this game anymore. It's like trying to play "Chutes and Ladders" or "Bingo" with your teenage friends. They probably haven't played those games in over 10 years and won't want to because they think its "outdated" or "boring" to them. I'd say the same for Counter-Strike for being an old game, but that game at least has an undieing community left from, even if the game came out BEFORE Ricochet. Ricochet though... yeah, there's not much of a big enough community that can sustain this game (If there was anything of a "community" left) Ricochet over the years wasn't able to keep the "special key" that's kept players STILL PLAYING Counter-Strike 1.6, and without that, well...

Sure, I bet when this game came out it was HUGE. I can see that with the amount of servers still operating even after over 15 years of this game being released. But like I said, they're empty. I think it's about time that we just lend our closures to this dead game and just focus on other games that have WAY more content than what Ricochet has to offer. Sure, it's innovative, original, and... JK, no. It's pretty much ripping off one of Tron's titles that involves "throwing discs" (except for the maps and map mechanics, that, at least, is very creative)

Oh, and BTW (sorry to say), this was probably the worst Valve game I've ever played. And that's probably saying a lot considering almost all of Valve's games are critically acclaimed.

This game absolutely changed my life.

Самая гениальная игра!

Ok so.......this game should've been the 2015 GOTY.  Witcher Three has literally nothing on this.  Anyways when I was little boy I often dreamed of throwing discs at people and bouncing around.  Frisbee was a start but not what I truly desired.  Then I found it.  Ricochet.  Arguably the most graphicly intense game I've ever played.  You'll need at least two gigs of Ram.  And a GTX Titan Z.  Much like Ricochets gameplay, my review is bouncing all over the place.  Which brings me back to the flashback story.  After I tried Frisbee I found Ricochet.  But it took me years to build a monster capable of handling this beast.  And when I finally connected this year.   I WAS ASTOUNDED!  The community was so alive and large!  I found one player every sixty servers.  I was impressed at the hype and community that Valve had managed to build such an amazing fanbase.  They really should sue Tron but I think they take pity.  And with that I started playing a match.  It was like reaching enlightenment.  Discs were flying everywhere!  Left and right!  Even more left and right!  One perfect feature that adds to my immersion is the inability to throw discs up or down.  Because frankly that's just not how they were meant to be thrown.  Dank you Valve for this Magnum Opus of game development!   Final Verdict is a Yes out of Maybe.  Buy a four pack for your friends and get going on the empty one hundred servers!

This game is like the distilled essence of The Starry Night by Vincent van Gogh, like pure inspiration put to computer screen, raw and powerful. The soundtrack is unmatched, the mechanics, artful. But by far the best parts of this masterpiece are the graphics, which beg the beholder fall to his knees in awe at the incredible realism, equalling, nay, surpassing the real world. Ladies and gentlemen, I give you Ricochet! The one, the only, the best GAME EVER!

One of the best games outthere. Unfortunately the servers are always empty ;(

Ricochet is a very pleasant surprise - it is one of the funnest games I have ever played. From reviews I would've thought it's just one of those "10 minutes at a time" and at first that was true. For the first match I played. However, very soon after that, my friends bought Ricochet as well after seeing me play so we got into a server with about 15 other people and had the fun of our lives. It is highly addictive as nicotine. The graphics are nicely done for the time and never once did I think the game is ugly. There isn't much variety in the gameplay, but it is fun and you will come back to it daily. Good thing is that if you have friends this game is an ABSOLUTE BLAST and you will love it for however long you play it. One time I played the game for 100 minutes straight, until I realised I was playing too much.

Get this game... NOW!
And the game isn't dead, as the people say. It has a great community with really funny people, and sometimes the servers can have more than 15 players, and that is fucking chaos when you don't even know what is happening, but usually there's about 10 people playing overall, so bring your friends over and have fun.

A game you'll play once for 10 minutes, then question the decisions you made in your life up to that point. Playing Pick Up Sticks in the backyard is more satisfying and fulfilling than this steaming pile of failure.

Throughout my whole life, I have never been very good at frisbee. I have tried to join an ultimate frisbee team, tried to play frisbee at my school, and even watched both of the Tron movies twenty times over... but alas, I still cannot throw a frisbee straight. I thought my dream career of frisbee champion was destined to fail... until now. This game has taught me everything I need to know about throwing frisbees. I now know how to bounce frisbees off of walls, throw three fribees at once, and even decapiate people with frisbees. After only 30 minutes of playing this game, I have become the world Ultimate Frisbee champion. Thank you Ricochet... you have saved my dream... you have made my life worth living.

10/10 IGN

10/10 The Verge

10/10 PCGamer

10/10 Gameinformer 

10/10 PCmag

Very Positive Steam Reviews

I feel as though many, and I mean many people glossed over this masterpiece. It's better than any game out here today! Better than Fallout 4, that's for sure! 

It's gameplay is nice and the players are very competitive. 

I think a simple remake of the game with amazing graphics and state of the art mechanicing could easily bring popularity back into it!
I hope to see this be the launch title for a possible Source3 engine!!

I think Valve did an amazing job on this game. I just wish more people would appreciate this hard work and effort. I'd give it the GOTY award, if only it counted for games of old.
